result.execSummary:
The defendant JACK S ALBRIGHT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JACK S ALBRIGHT

records.addlTxt: Invoice for Ct Appt'd Atty Fees - $620.00 (Atty Justin Sondalle)             (10/11 - approved by the court)

2:42 PM Defendant JACK S ALBRIGHT in court.  Attorney Justin M Sondalle in court for JACK S ALBRIGHT.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 as repeater with a fine, costs and DNA sample and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in. DA concurs. Atty Sondalle concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Sondalle. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$250 fine plus costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 2:50 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
for Leave to File Additional Motions
Return date on August 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Letter to the defendant dated 05/10/2022 re: Court appoints Atty Justin Sondalle. Defendant to pay $50 every two weeks commencing June 1, 2022 and every two weeks thereafter for court appointed attorney fees.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Justin Sondalle)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant JACK S ALBRIGHT in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he filled out the paperwork for a court appointed attorney. Def does not qualify for the public defender but did go through the proper channels to apply for a court appointed attorney. Defendant states he can pay $50 every two weeks for a court appointed attorney. Court instructs the defendant his first payment would be due June 01, 2022.  Court will set a court date after an attorney is appointed. Court instructs defendant to contact the clerk of courts in 30 days if he doesn't hear anything about counsel.

10:13 AM Defendant JACK S ALBRIGHT in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes he has received a request for a court appointed attorney. Def states he has not contacted two attorneys and he has not contacted the public defenders. Court instructs defendant on his attorney rights. Court instructs def to contact public defender to see if he qualifies and if he does not to contact two attorneys. Court sets Status of Counsel for May 3, 2022 at 11:30 AM.

Court adjourned:10:15 AM
Second appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Second appearance on May 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Second appearance on April 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:52 AM Defendant JACK S ALBRIGHT appeared in court, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY. Def would like counsel for this case. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Statement by defendant. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond. Court will set for Status of Counsel Hearing on April 05, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:55 AM.
